verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
parts: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy
brother,

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
parts: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort, who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
parts: Blessed
the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.

verses.text: who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
parts: who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble, with the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.

verses.text: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds through Christ.
parts: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds through Christ.

verses.text: For we do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, of our trouble which came to us in Asia: that we were burdened beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life. Yes, we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead, who delivered us from so great a death, and does a deliver us; in whom we trust that He will still deliver us, you also helping together in prayer for us, that thanks may be given by many persons on our a behalf for the gift granted to us through many.

verses.text: For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience that we conducted ourselves in the world in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God, and more abundantly toward you.
parts: For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience that we conducted ourselves in the world in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God, and more abundantly toward you.

verses.text: For we are not writing any other things to you than what you read or understand.
parts: For we are not writing any other things to you than what you read or understand.

verses.text: (as also you have understood us in part), that we are your boast as you also are
parts: (as also you have understood us in part), that we are your boast as you also

verses.text: And in this confidence I intended to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit— to pass by way of you to Macedonia, to come again from Macedonia to you, and be helped by you on my way to Judea.
parts: And in this confidence I intended to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit—
to pass by way of you to Macedonia, to come again from Macedonia to you, and be helped by you on my way to Judea.

verses.text: Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do it lightly?
parts: Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do it lightly?

verses.text: But as
parts: But

verses.text: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us—by me, Silvanus, and Timothy—was not Yes and No, but in Him was Yes.
parts: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us—by me, Silvanus, and Timothy—was not Yes and No, but in Him was Yes.

parts: For all the promises of God in Him

parts: Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us

verses.text: who also has sealed us and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee.
parts: who also has sealed us and given us the Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee.

verses.text: Moreover I call God as witness against my soul, that to spare you I came no more to Corinth. Not that we have dominion over your faith, but are fellow workers for your joy; for by faith you stand.
parts: Moreover I call God as witness against my soul, that to spare you I came no more to Corinth.
Not that we have dominion over your faith, but are fellow workers for your joy; for by faith you stand.

headers: Paul's Ministry: The Glory of God
Apostolic Motivation: Fearing and Loving God

verses.text: But I determined this within myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.
parts: But I determined this within myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.

verses.text: For if I make you sorrowful, then who is he who makes me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me?
parts: For if I make you sorrowful, then who is he who makes me glad but the one who is made sorrowful by me?

verses.text: And I wrote this very thing to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow over those from whom I ought to have joy, having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all.
parts: And I wrote this very thing to you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow over those from whom I ought to have joy, having confidence in you all that my joy is
of you all.

verses.text: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you, with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have so abundantly for you.
parts: For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you, with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have so abundantly for you.

verses.text: But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, but all of you to some extent—not to be too severe. This punishment which was inflicted by the majority is sufficient for such a man, so that, on the contrary, you ought rather to forgive and comfort him, lest perhaps such a one be swallowed up with too much sorrow.
parts: But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, but all of you to some extent—not to be too severe.

verses.text: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ's gospel, and a door was opened to me by the Lord, I had no rest in my spirit, because I did not find Titus my brother; but taking my leave of them, I departed for Macedonia.

verses.text: Now thanks be to God who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and through us diffuses the fragrance of His knowledge in every place. For we are to God the fragrance of Christ among those who are being saved and among those who are perishing.

verses.text: And we have such trust through Christ toward God. Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think of anything as being from ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God, who also made us sufficient as ministers of the new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit; a for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

verses.text: But we all, with unveiled face, beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory, just as by the Spirit of the Lord.

verses.text: Therefore, since we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we do not lose heart. But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
parts: Therefore, since we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we do not lose heart.

But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.

verses.text: But even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing,
parts: But even if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing,

verses.text: whose minds the god of this age has blinded, who do not believe, lest the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them.
parts: whose minds the god of this age has blinded, who do not believe, lest the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them.

verses.text: For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your bondservants for Jesus’ sake.

verses.text: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us. We are hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair; persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed— always carrying about in the body the dying of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our body.
parts: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellence of the power may be of God and not of us.

verses.text: For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus’ sake, that the life of Jesus also may be manifested in our mortal flesh.

verses.text: So then death is working in us, but life in you.
parts: So then death is working in us, but life in you.

verses.text: For we know that if our earthly house, this tent, is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens. For in this we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven, if indeed, having been clothed, we shall not be found naked.

verses.text: And in this I give advice: It is to your advantage not only to be doing what you began and were desiring to do a year ago; but now you also must complete the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to desire it, so there also may be a completion out of what you have.

verses.text: Now concerning the ministering to the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you; for I know your willingness, about which I boast of you to the Macedonians, that Achaia was ready a year ago; and your zeal has stirred up the majority.

verses.text: Now I, Paul, myself am pleading with you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ—who in presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you. But I beg you that when I am present I may not be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.
parts: Now I, Paul, myself am pleading with you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ—who in presence
lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you.
But I beg
that when I am present I may not be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh.

verses.text: Did I commit sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I preached the gospel of God to you free of charge? I robbed other churches, taking wages from them to minister to you.

verses.text: And when I was present with you, and in need, I was a burden to no one, for what I lacked the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied.
parts: And when I was present with you, and in need, I was a burden to no one, for what I lacked the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied.

verses.text: As the truth of Christ is in me, no one shall stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia.

verses.text: But what I do, I will also continue to do, that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be regarded just as we are in the things of which they boast.

parts: Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I was shipwrecked; a night and a day I have been in the deep;

verses.text: in
in weariness and toil, in sleeplessness often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness—

verses.text: besides the other things, what comes upon me daily: my deep concern for all the churches.
parts: besides the other things, what comes upon me daily: my deep concern for all the churches.

verses.text: Who is weak, and I am not weak?
parts: Who is weak, and I am not weak?

verses.text: If I must boast, I will boast in the things which concern my infirmity.
parts: If I must boast, I will boast in the things which concern my infirmity.

verses.text: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
parts: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.

verses.text: In Damascus the governor, under Aretas the king, was guarding the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me;
parts: In Damascus the governor, under Aretas the king, was guarding the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me;

verses.text: but I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall, and escaped from his hands.
parts: but I was let down in a basket through a window in the wall, and escaped from his hands.

verses.text: It is doubtless a not profitable for me to boast.
parts: It is doubtless
not profitable for me to boast.

verses.text: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago—whether in the body I do not know, or whether out of the body I do not know, God knows—such a one was caught up to the third heaven.
parts: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago—whether in the body I do not know, or whether out of the body I do not know, God knows—such a one was caught up to the third heaven.

verses.text: And I know such a man—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows—
parts: And I know such a man—whether in the body or out of the body I do not know, God knows—

verses.text: how he was caught up into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
parts: how he was caught up into Paradise and heard inexpressible words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

verses.text: Of such a one I will boast; yet of myself I will not boast, except in my infirmities.
parts: Of such a one I will boast; yet of myself I will not boast, except in my infirmities.

verses.text: For though I might desire to boast, I will not be a fool; for I will speak the truth.
parts: For though I might desire to boast, I will not be a fool; for I will speak the truth.

verses.text: And lest I should be exalted above measure by the abundance of the revelations, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I be exalted above measure. Concerning this thing I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might depart from me.
parts: And lest I should be exalted above measure by the abundance of the revelations, a thorn in the flesh was given to me, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I be exalted above measure.
Concerning this thing I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might depart from me.

verses.text: Concerning this thing I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might depart from me.
parts: Concerning this thing I pleaded with the Lord three times that it might depart from me.

verses.text: And He said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for My strength is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
parts: And He said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for My strength is made perfect in weakness.” Therefore most gladly I will rather boast in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

verses.text: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in needs, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ's sake.
parts: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in needs, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ's sake.

verses.text: I have become a fool in boasting; a you have compelled me.
parts: I have become a fool in boasting;
you have compelled me.

verses.text: Truly the signs of an apostle were accomplished among you with all perseverance, in signs and wonders and mighty deeds.
parts: Truly the signs of an apostle were accomplished among you with all perseverance, in signs and wonders and mighty deeds.

verses.text: For what is it in which you were inferior to other churches, except that I myself was not burdensome to you?
parts: For what is it in which you were inferior to other churches, except that I myself was not burdensome to you?

verses.text: Now for the third time I am ready to come to you.
parts: Now
the third time I am ready to come to you.

verses.text: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for your souls; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I am loved.
parts: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for your souls; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I am loved.

verses.text: But be that as it may, I did not burden you.
parts: But be that
I did not burden you.

verses.text: Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you?
parts: Did I take advantage of you by any of those whom I sent to you?

parts: I urged Titus, and sent our brother with

parts: For I fear lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I wish, and

verses.text: lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and I shall mourn for many who have sinned before and have not repented of the uncleanness, fornication, and lewdness which they have practiced.
parts: lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and I shall mourn for many who have sinned before and have not repented of the uncleanness, fornication, and lewdness which they have practiced.

verses.text: This will be the third time I am coming to you.
parts: This
the third
I am coming to you.

verses.text: I have told you before, and foretell as if I were present the second time, and now being absent I write a
parts: I have told you before, and foretell as if I were present the second time, and now being absent I write

verses.text: since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, who is not weak toward you, but mighty in you.
parts: since you seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, who is not weak toward you, but mighty in you.

verses.text: For though He was crucified in weakness, yet He lives by the power of God.
parts: For though He was crucified in weakness, yet He lives by the power of God.

verses.text: Examine yourselves as to whether you are in the faith.
parts: Examine yourselves
whether you are in the faith.

verses.text: But I trust that you will know that we are not disqualified.
parts: But I trust that you will know that we are not disqualified.

verses.text: Now I a pray to God that you do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that you should do what is honorable, though we may seem disqualified.
parts: Now I
pray to God that you do no evil, not that we should appear approved, but that you should do what is honorable, though we may seem disqualified.

verses.text: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.
parts: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

verses.text: For we are glad when we are weak and you are strong.
parts: For we are glad when we are weak and you are strong.

verses.text: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the authority which the Lord has given me for edification and not for destruction.
parts: Therefore I write these things being absent, lest being present I should use sharpness, according to the authority which the Lord has given me for edification and not for destruction.

verses.text: Finally, brethren, farewell.
parts: Finally, brethren, farewell.

verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
parts: Greet one another with a holy kiss.

verses.text: All the saints greet you.
parts: All the saints greet you.

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
parts: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit
with you all.
